headerDisplay: [homebridge-myq](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq) provides HomeKit support to myQ-enabled smart garage door openers and other devices.
footerDisplay: See the [homebridge-myq developer page](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq) for detailed documentation, including [feature options](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq#feature-options).

email.title: myQ Username
email.description: Email address used for your myQ account.

password.title: myQ Password
password.description: Password used for your myQ account.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name to assign this plugin for logging purposes. Default: myQ.

items.title: Feature Option
items.description: Enter only one option per entry. See project page for the complete list of available options.

mqttTopic.title: MQTT Base Topic
mqttTopic.description: The base MQTT topic to publish to. Default: myq.

mqttUrl.title: MQTT Broker URL
mqttUrl.description: URL for the MQTT broker you'd like to publish event messages to. Default: None.

refreshInterval.title: Refresh Interval
refreshInterval.description: Normal myQ status refresh interval, in seconds. Default: 12.

activeRefreshInterval.title: Active Refresh Interval
activeRefreshInterval.description: Refresh interval in seconds to use once device state changes are detected. Default: 3.

activeRefreshDuration.title: Active Refresh Duration
activeRefreshDuration.description: Duration in seconds to use the Active Refresh Interval to query for additional device state changes. Default: 300.

debug.title: Debug Logging
debug.description: Logging verbosity for debugging. Default: false.

items.description: Enter your myQ username and password below.

Feature options allow you to further customize the behavior of this plugin such as the ability to show or hide specific garage door openers. (one of the following: Enable.SerialNumber, Disable.SerialNumber, ReadOnly.SerialNumber)
MQTT support will only be enabled if an MQTT broker URL is specified below.
These settings should be rarely used or needed by most people. Use these with caution.
